definitions.definition: The quality of being confident , not afraid or easily intimidated , but without being incautious or inconsiderate .
examples: It takes a lot of courage to be successful in business.

definitions.definition: The ability to overcome one's fear, do or live things which one finds frightening .
examples: He plucked up the courage to tell her how he felt.

definitions.definition: The ability to maintain one's will or intent despite either the experience of fear , frailty , or frustration ; or the occurrence of adversity , difficulty , defeat or reversal .  Moral fortitude.

main_definition: The quality of being confident , not afraid or easily intimidated , but without being incautious or inconsiderate .
secondary_definitions: The ability to overcome one's fear, do or live things which one finds frightening .
The ability to maintain one's will or intent despite either the experience of fear , frailty , or frustration ; or the occurrence of adversity , difficulty , defeat or reversal .  Moral fortitude.
